intro: Siphonochilus nigericus, commonly known as the black-stemmed siphonochilus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
